class.name: Word.BuildingBlockCategory
class.description: Represents a category of building blocks in a Word document.

properties.name: buildingBlocks
properties.description: Returns a BuildingBlockCollection object that represents the building blocks for the category.

examples.description: Get all building blocks from the "General" category and insert the first one into the document at the current selection.

properties.name: context
properties.description: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.

examples.description: Access the request context from a BuildingBlockCategory object to verify the connection between the add-in and Word application before performing operations.

properties.name: index
properties.description: Returns the position of the BuildingBlockCategory object in a collection.

examples.description: Get the position of the first building block category in the collection and display it in the console.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Returns the name of the BuildingBlockCategory object.

examples.description: Get and display the name of the first building block category in the document's gallery.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Returns a BuildingBlockTypeItem object that represents the type of building block for the building block category.

examples.description: Get the building block type (such as AutoText, Quick Parts, etc.) from a building block category and display it in the console.

methods.name: load
methods.description: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.

examples.description: Load and display the name and type properties of a building block category

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Overrides the JavaScript toJSON() method in order to provide more useful output when an API object is passed to JSON.stringify(). (JSON.stringify, in turn, calls the toJSON method of the object that's passed to it.) Whereas the original Word.BuildingBlockCategory object is an API object, the toJSON method returns a plain JavaScript object (typed as Word.Interfaces.BuildingBlockCategoryData) that contains shallow copies of any loaded child properties from the original object.

returns.description: a plain JavaScript object (typed as Word.Interfaces.BuildingBlockCategoryData) that contains shallow copies of any loaded child properties from the original object.

examples.description: Serialize a building block category to JSON format for logging or data export purposes.

methods.name: track
methods.description: Track the object for automatic adjustment based on surrounding changes in the document. This call is a shorthand for context.trackedObjects.add(thisObject). If you're using this object across .sync calls and outside the sequential execution of a ".run" batch, and get an "InvalidObjectPath" error when setting a property or invoking a method on the object, you need to add the object to the tracked object collection when the object was first created. examples.description: Track a building block category object to use it across multiple sync calls when searching for and displaying category information
